content_index.sheet_name: Improve My Relationship with My Teen

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Spending One-on-One Time with My Teen
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about spending one-on-one time with Your Teen. 😃
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list: Spending one-on-one time with Your Teen will help you build trust, respect, and a positive relationship between you and Your Teen.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I spend special time with my teen, I need to decide what we will do together.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

🚲Your teen can choose the activity as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

🚲 You do not have to plan an activity. Your teen can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Let’s see how {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} spend one-on-one time together:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how was your day?”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: “My day was good, {F1_FATHER}. I just came from school.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “I have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spare before I have to drive to work again. What would you like to do together?”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: “I was about to do my Science homework. The topic for the homework is to make something out of recycled materials. Could you please help me with it?”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “I would be happy to!”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: “I thought of building a recycled house using old bottles, boxes, and other recycled materials. Look! I picked these up on my way home. They were thrown away by the side of the road and outside the spaza shops.”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “What a good idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Sounds like you’ve thought about this a lot and want to put a lot of effort into your homework. How do you want me to help you?”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: “Could you help me clean these bottles? They will be the pillars of the house. I will make the boxes into the walls and roof of the house. Later, I thought we could paint the boxes and bottles so they look beautiful.”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “I may have some leftover paint outside the house. I can take a look later.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.5:
(Later in the day) 

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Wow, it looks different now! It does not look like you used rubbish at all anymore. You also painted the walls and the roof beautifully! I think your teacher will be proud of you when she sees your homework!”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: “Thank you for your help, {F1_FATHER}. You know, there were a lot of fun things that happened in school today.” 

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Go ahead, tell me!”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣tips to remember to help you make the most of spending one-on-one time with Your Teen: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ *DAY - Try to do it every day*

⏰ Spend 5 minutes (or more!) with Your Teen each day.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ *PLAY - Let them choose the activity*

⏰ Ask to spend time with Your Teen.

⚽ Let them choose what to do or talk about.

🎈Try different activities together.

😃 Have fun!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ *STAY - Focus on your teen*

📺 Switch off the TV, put aside phones and remove distractions.

👀 Look at Your Teen. Nod or say “I see” to show you are really paying attention.
 
💛 Accept your teen and avoid judgement.
 
👂 Repeat in your own words what your teen says. It shows you are really listening to them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.video.message:
Here’s a video to learn 3️⃣ three tips to remember about spending one-on-one time with Your Teen.

1️⃣ DAY - Try to do it every day

3️⃣ STAY - Focus on your teen

Here’s an audio message to learn 3️⃣ three tips to remember about spending one-on-one time with Your Teen.

1️⃣ DAY - Try to do it every day

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ⭐ This week, try to spend at least 5 minutes of quality one-on-one time with Your Teen every day. It will make such a difference! Do you have time to do it today? ⏰
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you learnt today, and have fun! Spending one-on-one time with Your Teen is a great way to form a positive relationship with them. 💙
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list:
Well done for taking the time to learn how to improve your relationship with Your Teen. It shows you really care! 💙
;
😃How did the message above make you feel?
🌷We all feel better when we are praised.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
Praising Your Teen when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you and your teen. ⭐

Begin by praising Your Teen during your one-on-one time
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: The way you praise Your Teen does not matter because any kind of praise is effective.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

✨ How you praise your teen is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

🌱 You can begin by praising your teen for the smallest things, such as putting away their clothes after school.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

✨ How you praise your teen is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

🌱 You can begin by praising your teen for the smallest things, such as putting away their clothes after school.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Here is a comic about how you can praise Your Teen during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1: {F3_MOTHER} and {F3_DAUGHTER_12} are spending one-on-one time. {F3_DAUGHTER_12} asked {F3_MOTHER} to help with her homework.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Well done, {F3_DAUGHTER_12}! I think you finally got it. You know, maths was always hard for me.”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_12}**: “Really? I thought it was just me.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
(After completing homework)

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “This is not easy. I learned something, too! Thank you for letting me help you with your homework, 
{F3_DAUGHTER_12}. You are making great progress.”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_12}**: “Thank you, {F3_MOTHER}. I really appreciate that you took the time to help me out.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro:
When you bring attention to good behaviours, your teen is likely to behave well more often and feel good about themselves!

Here are 4️⃣ simple tips for praising Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ *SEE IT*

👀 Look for anything good or helpful that Your Teen does.

⏸ Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ *SAY IT*

🏆 Praise them when you see them do something you like.

✅ Tell them specifically what they have done well.

🎉 Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

🔄 This way, they are more likely to do it again.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ *REPEAT IT*

🌷 Look for something to praise Your Teen for every day.

🔶 Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ *KEEP IT POSITIVE*

💡 Make sure you focus on something Your Teen has done well.

🙂You can show your praise with a big smile and words. You can also give Your Teen a thumbs-up, hug, or high-five to show you appreciate them.

🌈 Keeping it positive reminds your teen that you notice them and care.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.video.message:
⭐ Teens respond well to praise. When you praise Your Teen for trying and for good behaviour, they will continue to  behave well.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.activity: Your Home Activity today is to try to praise Your Teen during one-on-one time. Can you do it today?
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: Amazing! 🎉 Try to praise Your Teen at least once during one-on-one time. You can also praise Your Teen at other times during the day. Notice how they respond.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: 💚 That's OK! Sometimes, things take time. You can review this lesson in the Main Menu at any time. At the end of the day, think of all of the positive things that happened - this makes it easier to point them out. ☀️ With time, it will become easier for you to praise your teen.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have now learnt the four steps to Praise! ⭐ You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod lessons in the course {goal_name}.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Creating a Routine for One-on-One Time
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about creating routines for spending one-on-one time with Your Teen. 🔄
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
To continue building a positive relationship with Your Teen, let’s make one-on-one time a part of a routine. You can use the tips in this lesson to create other daily routines with Your Teen. 

Creating other daily routines with Your Teen will help them feel more calm and connected with you and behave better.  🔑 Help them plan time for resting, meals, chores, school, and sleep. ⏰
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Here is a comic about how you can create a routine for spending one-on-one time with Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “{F2_SON_15}, I really enjoyed spending one-on-one time with you yesterday. I never knew you were so good at soccer!”

**{F2_SON_15}**: “Aw…thanks, {F2_GRANDFATHER}!”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “It would be great if we could have time together more often. Should we try to do it every day?”

**{F2_SON_15}**: “I guess so…though sometimes I am busy.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “Yeah, that’s true. Let’s make it something that we can really do. I am sure we could find 15 minutes together!”

**{F2_SON_15}**: “Sure, we can try.”

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “When would be the best time for you?”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4:
**{F2_SON_15}**: “How about after dinner?”

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “That could work as long as we clean up first. Let’s start today. And remember, you can choose what we do!”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.5:
**{F2_SON_15}**: “Okay, {F2_GRANDFATHER}. I look forward to it.”

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “Thanks, {F2_SON_15}. I really appreciate having this time with you. It means a lot to me.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are some tips on how to create routines with Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE A TEAM

☕ Talk to Your Teen about what they want their routines to look like.

✨ Your Teen is more likely to follow routines when they help to create them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ BE CONSISTENT

👀 Make sure Your Teen follows their routines daily.

💙 This helps your teen feel secure, calm and connected to you because they know what to expect.

🌱 Feeling secure means Your Teen has space to grow, develop and gain independence.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE

🎈 Praise Your Teen for creating a routine with you.

🌈 Praise Your Teen when they stick to it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
Here are some other routines you could create with Your Teen in addition to one-on-one time:

✅ Bedtime
✅ Homework
✅ Chores
✅ Mealtime
✅ Free time
✅ T.V. or phone time

▶️Press Play to learn how to create daily routines with Your Teen. ⏰

2️⃣ BE CONSISTENT
3️⃣ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Try to create a routine on how you can spend 15 minutes of one-on-one time with your teen every day. 📝 Can you do it today?
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: That's great! Making one-on-one time a regular activity will mean a lot to Your Teen. You can also make other routines with them like having a meal together or going for a walk. It will help your teen feel loved connected to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! Beginning something new takes time. If you cannot do it every day, maybe start with every other day. Or instead of 15 minutes a day, try 5 minutes. You can also ask your teen for ideas on which routines could be useful for them. They might surprise you!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to create a routine with your teen! You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod lessons in the course {goal_name}.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about noticing your and Your Teen’s feelings during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
Noticing and talking about feelings with Your Teen will help them learn how to express themselves. 

👌They will learn that all feelings are okay - even the difficult ones.
 
🌷 You can help by listening to them, thinking about how it must feel for them, and accepting their emotions. 

🤗This will help them recognise other people’s feelings, too.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Talking about happy feelings is not as important as sharing difficult feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉That’s correct. 

6️⃣There are six basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. 

✅It’s important that we talk with our children about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

6️⃣There are six basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. 

✅It’s important that we talk with our children about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.2.question:
Here’s another one: 

Boys should not share when they are feeling sad or afraid.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

⭐ It is important that both boys and girls learn how to share their feelings. 

💙 They will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

⭐ It is important that both boys and girls learn how to share their feelings. 

💙 They will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it. This is important for girls, too!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.3.question:
Last one: 

As parents, we can also share our feelings with our teens.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
🎉 Correct! 

🌱Sharing our feelings with our teens in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

🌱Sharing our feelings with our teens in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Here is a comic about how you can talk about feelings with your teen during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_16} are spending one-on-one time by taking a walk together. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} looks very upset.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, I noticed you have less energy today and you look sad. Do you want to talk about it?” 
**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: “Oh, {F1_FATHER}. I studied so hard for my maths test and failed. I feel so sad and frustrated.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “That is frustrating, my girl. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can come up with a new plan to help you with maths. Should we ask your teacher for extra help? Would you like me to talk to her or do you want to do it?” 

**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: “Thank you, {F1_FATHER}. I can do it! I think that might be a good idea.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4: **{F1_FATHER}**: “You know, maths may be difficult for you, but I am so proud of you for studying so hard, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Other people might give up, but you keep trying. That will help you so much in life!”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are 6️⃣ tips for how you can help Your Teen learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, SHARE and CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ LEARN

💡 Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:

😃Happy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.

😔Sad: Something important in your life needs attention.

🔴Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.

😣Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.

👀Surprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.

🚩Afraid: Run away from danger.

🎨 As teens, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ NOTICE

👀 Begin observing these 6 emotions in yourself and in Your Teen.

😃😒😔😣 Notice how each emotion feels in your body.
 
😃 You can also notice positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.

💙 Noticing can also help your teen to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ OPEN

Be open, notice 👀, and listen 👂 to Your Teen when they share how they are feeling. 
💛 Accept how you and Your Teen feel. Remember, your body and their body are sending messages about what you both are feeling, and those messages are important.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ TALK

😒 It is normal to struggle to talk about and express emotions and feelings. 

📝 Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.

⭐ When Your Teen is feeling an emotion, describe what you are observing in a calm way. 
For example, 

“I notice you slammed the door, talk loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry because you can’t go out at night?”

You can also help Your Teen manage different emotions by encouraging them to share how they feel and supporting them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.5.text:
5️⃣ SHARE

😃 Share your own feelings with Your Teen. 

For example, “I would feel the same way if I couldn’t go out when I wanted to”. 

 🎈This sets a good example and shows Your Teen that it's okay to share their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.6.text:
6️⃣ CARE

🌷 Use actions and words to make Your Teen feel accepted and loved. 

⭐ Do some active exercise to shake out anger, give each other some space, or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some ways to deal with your emotions. 

💚 Remind Your Teen that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Keeping Calm When We Are Stressed
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. 💚
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
As you began noticing feelings, you may have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness. 

🌷 We love our teens, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life! 

💡 It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I am angry at my teen, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct! 

💛 It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

💛 It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_15} but finds the living room in a mess. She notices that this makes her feel angry.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): “I’m feeling really angry. I am tired and my body feels tense. I just want to shout at {F2_SON_15}”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): “I will Take a Pause and put on my favourite song.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): “I am feeling a little better. I can think more clearly about what to do to support my teen.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “{F2_SON_15}, well done for doing your homework. You might  feel tired now. Let's take a 5-minute break, and after that, we can quickly pick up the mess together.”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.5: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “Thank you for doing your part to keep the house clean, {F2_SON_15}! I’m so proud of you for helping. Oh! It is our one-on-one time. What would you like to do?”
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: There are 4️⃣ steps to keeping calm in stressful situations: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ *BE CALM*

✅ Be aware of your own feelings.

✅Take a pause or a few breaths before asking Your Teen to do something else.

✅ Speak with Your Teen in a calm voice.

✅ Remember your goal: Help Your Teen feel loved and connected to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ *BE QUICK*

⏰ There are other things you can do to help manage unwanted behaviour before it becomes stressful. 

✨ Praise something positive that your teen did today. 

✨ Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to clean up after having fun or ending a big task. 

✨ When you see Your Teen is about to start unwanted behaviour, distract them by asking them to do something else, before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse. 

✨ Invite Your Teen in a chore you are doing. You can ask Your Teen to think of a fun and quick way of doing the chores differently. 

💡 Preventing unwanted behaviour is much easier than disciplining them after they have done something wrong!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ *BE CLEAR*

✅ Rather than saying what you DON’T want, tell Your Teen what you DO want them to do.

For example, say:

✨ “Please speak more softly.” instead of “Stop shouting!”

✨ “Remember to hang your jacket in your cupboard, please.” 
instead of “Don’t leave your jacket on the floor!”

This way, it is easier for them to follow! ⭐
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ *BE POSITIVE*

✅ Praise Your Teen when they behave well!

✅ Invite Your Teen to a positive activity when you see they are about to start an unwanted behaviour.

✅ It will also help them know what you expect from them!

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about learning how to keep your teens safe in your community. 🚩
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list: You are not alone! Parents all over the world say they worry about keeping their children safe.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.intro: Let’s test your knowledge about teen safety.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.question: Which of these is a space guaranteed to keep your teen safe?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.values: Home | A friend’s house | School | Church | Clinic | Park | Bar | None of the Above
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉You're right. 
Your teen can face harm anywhere, even at home 🏠 or church ⛪. As parents, it's our job to help them plan 📝 to avoid tough situations and handle them if they happen, no matter where they are 🌍.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 
Your teen can face harm anywhere, even at home 🏠 or church ⛪. As parents, it's our job to help them plan 📝 to avoid tough situations and handle them if they happen, no matter where they are 🌍.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.intro: Let’s check in on {F1_DAUGHTER_16} and her mom:
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.1:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: Something happened when I was out with my friends {FRIEND_FEMALE_1} and {FRIEND_FEMALE_2}!

**{F1_MOTHER}**: Tell me, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.2:
**{MAN_IN_CAR}**: Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what’s your name?

**{FRIEND_FEMALE_1}**: Her name is {F1_DAUGHTER_16}
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.3:
**{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_16}, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you’ll be back in time, I promise…

**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: I’m not sure if that’s a good idea…
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.4: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_1}**: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I’m telling you, if you don’t do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.5:
**{FRIEND_FEMALE_2}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_16} don’t go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you don’t know. Besides, he’s too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.

**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: I just don’t know…
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.6: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro:
One way to keep your teen safe is to create a safety map with them. Together, identify the safe and unsafe places in your community. 📖

Here are 3️⃣three steps to help you make a safety map together:
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
Step 1️⃣: **DRAW**

📝 Draw a map of your community.

🚩 Include the main places: streets, your house, school, shops, and places your teen visits.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
Step 2️⃣: **DECIDE**

🔑 Talk about the places on your map and decide if they are safe or not.

👂 Listen to your teen: they might know more than you think they do about where it is safe or unsafe.

🔵 CIRCLE the places that are safe for teenagers.

❌ CROSS OFF any places that are unsafe for teenagers.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
Step 3️⃣: **DISCUSS**

❗ Sometimes, we find ourselves in trouble.

👀 Discuss where you and your teen can get support in a crisis. These places may include home, school, police station, or a clinic. 

🚩 MARK these areas clearly with a ⭐ star on your map.

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: It can be hard to think about dangerous situations for your teen.
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in. 
We can help our teens know how to use their thoughts and voices, in dangerous situations. It makes a big difference!
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.intro: Check out these scenarios. What warning signs do you see?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.question: **Boy**: Hey beautiful, why are you walking so fast! Don’t you want to come show us what is under that skirt?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.values: The boy compliments the girl| The boy shows the girl attention| The boy acts disrespectfully
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct. 

It’s okay to compliment and show attention, but it must be done respectfully. 

In this case, the boy’s friend should speak up and correct his friend’s behaviour.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

It’s okay to compliment and show attention, but it must be done respectfully. 

In this case, the boy’s friend should speak up and correct his friend’s behaviour.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.question:
Let’s try another. What are the warning signs?
;
**{TEACHER_1}**: {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, if you want to get good grades this year, you need to stay after school when everyone is gone so I can tutor you.

**{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: My friend also needs support. Can I invite her too?

**{TEACHER_1}**: No, this will be our secret. You don’t want people to think you are stupid, right?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.values: The teacher abuses his power and pressures the girl|The teacher tries to help the girl with schoolwork|The girl asks to include a friend
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.answer: The teacher abuses his power and pressures the girl
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
🎉That’s right. 

Schools have strict rules to keep students safe. The teacher is abusing his power and knows it's wrong ❌. He has likely done this before and might do it again 🔁. {F2_DAUGHTER_17} could try to find others with the same experience 👥 to make reporting him easier 🗣️.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

The correct answer was “The teacher abuses his power and pressures the girl”.
;
Schools have strict rules to keep students safe. The teacher is abusing his power and knows it's wrong ❌. He has likely done this before and might do it again 🔁. {F2_DAUGHTER_17} could try to find others with the same experience 👥 to make reporting him easier 🗣️.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze ❄️ or get angry 😡 – that’s normal. These tools can help keep you and your teen safe: KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **KNOW IT**

Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships ❤️❌. If you're attacked, it’s never your fault. Do what you need to stay safe and get away —don't worry about what others think. You are worth defending 💪. You are strong and powerful ⚡.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **SEE IT**

If someone makes you or anyone else feel uncomfortable with what they say or do, it’s never okay! We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home 🏠. Trust your gut. If you feel attacked by words or actions, your goal is to get away.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **SAY IT**

Your voice can stop many attacks.  

Be clear, confident, and direct. Use your voice, body language, and eye contact. If you don't feel safe, you can do whatever it takes to get away.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.4.text:
Using your voice can look different in different situations. You could shout "No!", call for help, act strangely to confuse the attacker, or negotiate.
Here are some things you might say or shout to avoid a tough situation:
“I will call the police if you touch me again 🚔.”
“Do not touch my bum!” 👎
Or you might say:
“No lift for me, thanks! Last time I got a lift, I threw up!” 🤮
“I will give you my phone if you let me go.” 📱
Think about what you would do in some of the examples we have looked at. There is no wrong answer! ✨
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.5.text: Remember, if someone hurts you, it’s never your fault. Ask someone you trust for help 🤝. Make sure your teen knows they can tell you anything so you can find a solution together.
Keep My Teen Safe.video.message: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze ❄️ or get angry 😡 – that’s normal. Press Play ▶️ to learn the tools that can help keep you and your teen safe: **KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT**
Keep My Teen Safe.audio.message: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze ❄️ or get angry 😡 – that’s normal.Press Play ▶️ to learn the tools that can help keep you and your teen safe: **KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT**

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about learning how to respond to crises when they happen. ❗
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list: When our teens share something that is very hard or upsetting to them, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open so that they feel supported. 💛
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.intro: Here is an example of supporting  your teen, even when something really bad happens.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.1: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.2:
**{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: It’s my Uncle, he… he… he touched me.

**{F2_GRANDMOTHER} (thinking): Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and  comforting and to listen if she wants to talk.

**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I’m listening.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.3:
**{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: It’s true, he… he… made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I didn’t want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.4:
**{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that’s when it happened.

**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: It’s okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?

**{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: The clinic?
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.5:
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: That is a great suggestion, {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, let’s go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?

**{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Yes… Okay… But will you come with me?
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.6: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Of course I will. And {F2_DAUGHTER_17}? Remember this is not your fault. You did nothing to deserve this. I love you. We will get through this.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: Here are some things you can do to support your teen when they share something difficult with you:
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **BREATHE**: Take a pause

🌱 Take a deep breath so you can respond calmly.
💛 Ask yourself, “What does my teen need right now?”
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **LISTEN**: Ask Your Teen what is going on

👂 Let your teen share with you what they need.

👀 Notice what they are feeling and tell them what you notice so they feel heard.

💙 Tell your teen that you are there for them and love them.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **RESPOND**: What might help what is going on?

🔶 You might need to help your teen talk about their feelings or redirect their focus.

➡️ You might need to talk about the actions that you or your teen could take to help with what has happened.

⏸ Now isn’t the time to talk about how to keep safe in the future. Right now, your teen needs you to be there for them with love.

✅ Remember, you can always type {HELP} to ParentText and get information about resources in your community where you can get help.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ **COMFORT**: Be there for Your Teen
🌷 It can be hard to see your teen feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.
💚 They need you to accept them and comfort them when difficult things are going on.
🎈 Remind your teen again that you love them, and thank them for sharing with you.

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how to keep Your Teen safe online. There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over two lessons. 📱
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list: Teens are spending a lot of time online. Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more! But there are also some risks and dangers. 🚩
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.intro: Let's see how {F1_DAUGHTER_13}'s mother helps her stay safe online.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.1:
**{F1_MOTHER}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, have you done your homework?

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: Just a minute, I'm finishing this TikTok video.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.2:
**{F1_MOTHER}**: You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it.

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: All my friends are on it. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.3: **{F1_MOTHER}**: I’m proud of how well you dance, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}. But we need to make sure you are safe on this. I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are adults who are sexually attracted to young children and teens.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.4: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Let’s look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. Look – you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know but not strangers. Can we make a rule together that you can use TikTok but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱When it comes to online safety, there are four tips to keep in mind: 
LEARN, PROTECT, BUILD HABITS, and BUILD TRUST.

Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT. 
The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **LEARN** the dangers of being online:

🚩CONTENT: Your Teen might come across harmful content or content you think is inappropriate for them, such as violence, aggressive language, or pornography.

🚩 CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be teens and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your teen through an online platform.

🚩 CONDUCT: Sometimes, teens or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PROTECT** - Keep your teen safe online

✅ Talk to your teen about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!

✅ Help your teen learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices.

✅ Teach your teen that they should keep personal information private, including photos or videos of themselves. What goes online stays online!
Keep My Teen Safe.video.message:
Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

We are going to learn 4️⃣ tips to keep Your Child safe online: 
1️⃣ **LEARN**
2️⃣ **PROTECT**
3️⃣ **BUILD HABITS**
4️⃣ **BUILD TRUST**

Press Play ▶️ to learn about **LEARN** and **PROTECT**. 
✨ The next lesson will cover **BUILD HABITS** and **BUILD TRUST**.

Keep My Teen Safe.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! 🎉 Helping your teen stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! 🔑
Keep My Teen Safe.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your teen. ⏰ It’s important to talk to our teens about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ⭐

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson continues our learning about keeping our teens safe online. 📱
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list:
The previous lesson taught you ways to protect your teen online using **LEARN** and **PROTECT**. 

In this lesson, we will learn how to **BUILD HABITS** and **BUILD TRUST**.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.intro: Often, our teens understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe. Let’s test your online safety knowledge.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct. 

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.question: My password is strong because you have to know my home address to guess it.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ That’s correct. 

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.3.question: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
🎈 That’s right! 

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognise the web address, don’t click on it.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognise the web address, don’t click on it.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 Today, we are learning how to **BUILD HABITS** and **BUILD TRUST**.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣**BUILD HABITS**

Set up safe online habits at home. 

❌📱 Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.

⭐ Create rules with Your Teen about who they can chat with online. It is safest to only chat with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.

👀 Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.

📝 Help Your Teen create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.

❗ Tell Your Teen not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **BUILD TRUST** with your teen.

🌷 Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps Your Teen uses. 

👂 Ask questions - this helps you learn more about Your Teen’s interests!

💙 If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your teen. If you need support, type {HELP} after you complete today’s lesson or any other time you need extra support.  

✅ Tell Your Teen that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.

🚩Teach your teen that if a stranger offers gifts, like virtual coins, in exchange for photos and personal information and tells them to keep it a secret, they should tell you.
Keep My Teen Safe.video.message:
Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ **LEARN** and 2️⃣ **PROTECT** in the previous lesson.

Press Play ▶️ to learn how to 3️⃣ **BUILD HABITS** and 4️⃣ **BUILD TRUST**.
Keep My Teen Safe.audio.message:
Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ **LEARN** and 2️⃣ **PROTECT** in the previous lesson.

Keep My Teen Safe.home_activity.activity:
Home activity! ⭐

Take these steps to keep your teen safe online:

 📝 Write down or draw the apps and websites your teen uses.

🏅Praise your teen for how good they are at using the web!

🔴 Talk about which sites or apps might be unsafe. Why?

📱 Together, talk about how Your Teen and their friends can use the internet more safely.

Can you and Your Teen complete this task today? 🔔
Keep My Teen Safe.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Helping your teen stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! 🔑
Keep My Teen Safe.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your teen. ⏰ It’s important to talk to our teens about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ⭐

Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. 🌱
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. 
...
Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. 
...
Stretch to both sides. 
...
Stretch to the front and to the back.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
Let your hands hang by your side. 
...
Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. 
...
Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
...
Relax your arms and let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.4.text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.5.text: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.6.text:
Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. 
...
Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out, 4 more times.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.7.text:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 
...
Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
Understand Teen Development.video.message: ▶️Press play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
Understand Teen Development.audio.message: ▶️Press play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
Understand Teen Development.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Try to stretch and move at least once every day. Can you try it now?
Understand Teen Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference in how you feel each day. ⭐
Understand Teen Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference to how you feel each day. ⭐

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Mental Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this course, we are learning about the changes teens go through as they grow up. Today, we will learn about changes happening to your teen’s mind.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: When you understand how Your Teen is changing, you can provide them with the support they might need and keep them safe.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Let’s see how much you know about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they grow older!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: Which is common for teens?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: More Confidence|Less risk-taking|Struggling with identity and self-image|More trusting of people in charge
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Teens are trying to figure out who they are and what they want to be, which can be confusing and make them doubt themselves.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: 👀 Oops! Good Try! Teens often struggle with identity and self-image as they figure out who they are and what they want to be.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: How can parents help their teens cope with mood swings during adolescence?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Ignore their feelings|Punish them for their emotions|Let them know their feelings are okay and be there for them|Encourage them to ignore their emotions
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Let them know their feelings are okay and be there for them
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: You are right! Parents can help by listening to their teens, noticing their feelings, and being there for them.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Parents can help by letting their teen know their feelings are okay and being there for them.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: Why is it important to have healthy communication with your teen during adolescence?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: It's not important. Teens need to figure things out on their own|It helps build trust and strengthens relationships|It keeps my teen from keeping secrets
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: It helps build trust and strengthens relationships
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen’s developing mind and how to talk with them about it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ THE DEVELOPING MIND

🌱 Your Teen’s brain hasn’t changed this fast since they were a baby. 

🚩 Teens sometimes behave in risky ways as they test what is possible and allowed, especially if it is exciting or fun. 

❗ Teens don’t have the ability to always think ahead about how their behaviours might impact themselves or other people.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ BECOMING MORE INDEPENDENT

⭐ Teens are on their way to becoming adults.

🌈 They are becoming better at sharing their ideas and are thinking more about long-term goals and their future.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN

To support your teen:

🔑 Guide their choices by balancing rules and limits with independence. 

🏅 You can give them more freedom to make their own choices when they show they can be responsible and take responsibility for their actions.

✨ Be supportive, loving, and positive with your teen. This helps them feel more calm and connected with you, and they're more likely to come to you for help or advice when they need it.

Understand Teen Development.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Use one-on-one time to allow Your Teen to choose anything they would like to talk about. Listen to their experiences and avoid judgment. Notice how you feel and notice their feelings, too. Thank Your Teen for sharing with you. 

Can you do it today?
Understand Teen Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That's okay. Try to connect with Your Teen tomorrow.

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Social Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson we are continuing to learn about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they get older. Today we are exploring social changes.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: When you understand how Your Teen is growing and changing, you can help them when they face difficulties in social situations.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Let’s see how much you know about the social changes Your Teen may be experiencing:
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: Which of the following is a common social change that teens experience?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: They become less interested in spending time with friends.|They become less influenced by peer pressure.|They may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: They may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct. Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: 👀 Oops! Good Try! Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: How can parents help their teens handle social changes?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: By always choosing their friends for them|By encouraging them to make their own decisions and supporting them through the consequences|By avoiding discussions about social issues
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: By encouraging them to make their own decisions and supporting them through the consequences
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: What impact can bullying have on a teen?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: Improved self-esteem|A sense of belonging|Low self-esteem and avoiding interaction with others
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: Low self-esteem and avoiding interaction with others
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct. Bullying can make teens feel bad about themselves and become less social.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Bullying can make teens feel bad about themselves and become less social.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen’s social life and how to talk with them about it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ THE SOCIAL LIVES OF TEENS

⚽ Having friends is very important to Your Teen because it helps them learn how to be a good friend and understand other people's feelings better. This is a big part of growing up and becoming an adult.

👀 Your teen may want to feel like they belong with their peers and do things others think are cool. They might talk or dress like others while figuring out who they are. 

😔 Sometimes, when teens have a hard time making friends, they might be bullied by other kids.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN

🎨 Let Your Teen try different clothing and hairstyles and spend time with different people. Show them you accept them, just as they are. 

⏰ Tell Your Teen what you expect of them, but give them the freedom to make safe choices at home or outside, such as how to spend their free time.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ THE FACTS

Here are some facts to share with Your Child:

💙 Good friends look out for you, care about you, include you in activities, and treat you with respect. 

🚩 A bully is someone who keeps trying to hurt others, either by making them feel bad or using their strength to be mean. 

🌈 To stop bullying in school, it's important to be kind and respectful to others. This makes everyone feel happy and safe at school.

2️⃣ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN
3️⃣ THE FACTS

Home Activity! Use one-on-one time to talk to Your Teen about their friends. Who would they like to spend more time with? Who sets a great example for the class? Listen to Your Teen and accept what they are saying.

Do you have time to do it today?

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Physical Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson, we continue to learn about the changes your teen may experience as they get older. Today, we are exploring their physical changes. These changes are part of the phase of reaching sexual maturity called puberty.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: Talking openly with Your Teen about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Here’s a quick quiz to see how much you know about puberty!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for girls?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 8 and 13 for girls|A time when the mind becomes more mature. It often begins between ages 16 and 18 for girls|A time when the body stops growing. It often begins around age 25 for girls
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 8 and 13 for girls
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Puberty is when a person's body undergoes changes as they grow into adults. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: 👀 Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for girls?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Increased height, deeper voice, and wider shoulders|Growth of breasts, pubic and underarm hair, and menstruation|Less hunger, longer sleep patterns, and more energy levels
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Growth of breasts, pubic and underarm hair, and menstruation
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct! During puberty, girls undergo many physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. During puberty, girls go through a lot of physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: How can parents support their daughters during puberty?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support|By ignoring the changes and allowing their daughter to figure it out on her own|By discouraging their daughter from asking questions and seeking help if needed
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen’s developing body and how to talk with them about it:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ TALK

🌱 Help Your Teen understand it is normal to go through physical changes during puberty.

✅ Tell Your Teen that these changes happen to everyone and that they are not alone.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ LEARN

⭐ Provide Your Teen with accurate information about puberty, sex, and the changes they are experiencing. This will help them make good decisions to stay healthy and safe.

💛 Encourage them to ask questions and seek help if they need it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ SUPPORT

🍚 Encourage Your Teen to develop healthy habits like eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep, and exercising regularly.

⚽ Help them find activities they enjoy doing to feel confident and strong in their body.💙Help Your Teen think about the consequences of their behaviours without shame or blame. Guide them on where they can find information to inform their decisions.
Understand Teen Development.video.message:
▶️Press play to learn about the physical changes Your Teen is experiencing: 1️⃣ TALK
2️⃣ LEARN
3️⃣ SUPPORT
Understand Teen Development.audio.message:
▶️Press play to learn about the physical changes Your Teen is experiencing: 1️⃣ TALK
2️⃣ LEARN
3️⃣ SUPPORT
Understand Teen Development.home_activity.intro: Not all physical changes are related to puberty. Your Teen may also need support with seeing, talking, or physical movement. ParentText has a tool to assess Your Teen's development and determine if you should take them for a visit to the clinic.

Understand Teen Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 This activity will help you better support Your Teen’s development.
Understand Teen Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! Try to complete this task during the week. You can type {GROW} at any time to begin.
